item.title: [PIG-1282] [zebra] make Zebra's pig test cases run on real cluster
item.description:
The goal of this task is to make Zebra's pig test cases run on real cluster.

Currently Zebra's pig test cases are mostly tested using MiniCluster. We want to use a real hadoop cluster to test them.
item.summary: [zebra] make Zebra's pig test cases run on real cluster

The test case failure is caused by some environmental issue.

I reran the failed test case manually and it was successful.

org.apache.pig.test.TestSecondarySort

+1, though two repeated patterns that can be better organized. 1. removeDir() appears in many test cases. Ideally, this can be made as a method of some utility class. 2. Same logic of determine running mode (realCluster, miniCluster, MapReduce/Local) appears in most of these test cases. Ideally, this should be made as configurations instead of a bunch of if ... else... statements. Hopefully, these two issue can be addressed in the near future.

The new attached patch addressed the concerns raised by Xuefu Zhang.

All pig and map/reduce test cases get significantly polished.

The major changes include: (Please see pig/TestBasicTableUnionLoader for example)

1) all test case extend BaseTestCase, call init() within setup();

2) use getTableFullPath() utility function

3) use removeDir() utility function

This task involves lots of mechanical work and many thanks to Jax Law, Xuefu Zhang, Gaurav Jain and Yan Zhou for sharing the load.
